param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_FV_CPLNG_K
param.documentation: Used to decouple pitch from forward/vertical motion. 0 to disable, 1.2 normal

param.name: MOT_9_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_10_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_11_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_12_DIRECTION
param.documentation: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

param.name: MOT_YAW_HEADROOM
param.documentation: Yaw control is given at least this pwm in microseconds range

param.name: MOT_THST_EXPO
param.documentation: Motor thrust curve exponent (0.0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

param.name: MOT_SPIN_MAX
param.documentation: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

param.name: MOT_BAT_VOLT_MAX
param.documentation: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 4.2 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

param.name: MOT_BAT_VOLT_MIN
param.documentation: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 3.3 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

param.name: MOT_BAT_CURR_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

param.name: MOT_PWM_TYPE
param.documentation: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output

param.name: MOT_PWM_MIN
param.documentation: This sets the min PWM output value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MIN

param.name: MOT_PWM_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the max PWM value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MAX

param.name: MOT_SPIN_MIN
param.documentation: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

param.name: MOT_SPIN_ARM
param.documentation: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

param.name: MOT_BAT_CURR_TC
param.documentation: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

param.name: MOT_THST_HOVER
param.documentation: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

param.name: MOT_HOVER_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

param.humanName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed
param.name: MOT_SAFE_DISARM
param.documentation: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed

param.name: MOT_YAW_SV_ANGLE
param.documentation: Yaw servo's maximum lean angle

param.name: MOT_SPOOL_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

param.name: MOT_BOOST_SCALE
param.documentation: Booster motor output scaling factor vs main throttle. The output to the BoostThrottle servo will be the main throttle times this scaling factor. A higher scaling factor will put more of the load on the booster motor. A value of 1 will set the BoostThrottle equal to the main throttle.

param.name: MOT_BAT_IDX
param.documentation: Which battery monitor should be used for doing compensation

param.humanName: Output slew time for increasing throttle
param.name: MOT_SLEW_UP_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to slew output from zero to full. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

param.humanName: Output slew time for decreasing throttle
param.name: MOT_SLEW_DN_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to slew output from full to zero. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

param.humanName: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.
param.name: MOT_SAFE_TIME
param.documentation: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.

param.name: MSP_OSD_NCELLS
param.documentation: Used for average cell voltage calculation

param.name: MSP_OPTIONS
param.documentation: A bitmask to set some MSP specific options

param.name: NTF_LED_BRIGHT
param.documentation: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_TYPES
param.documentation: Controls what types of Buzzer will be enabled

param.humanName: Specifies colour source for the RGBLed
param.name: NTF_LED_OVERRIDE
param.documentation: Specifies the source for the colours and brightness for the LED. OutbackChallenge conforms to the MedicalExpress (https://uavchallenge.org/medical-express/) rules, essentially "Green" is disarmed (safe-to-approach), "Red" is armed (not safe-to-approach). Traffic light is a simplified color set, red when armed, yellow when the safety switch is not surpressing outputs (but disarmed), and green when outputs are surpressed and disarmed, the LED will blink faster if disarmed and failing arming checks.

param.name: NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE
param.documentation: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

param.name: NTF_OREO_THEME
param.documentation: Enable/Disable Solo Oreo LED driver, 0 to disable, 1 for Aircraft theme, 2 for Rover theme

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_PIN
param.documentation: Enables to connect active buzzer to arbitrary pin. Requires 3-pin buzzer or additional MOSFET!

param.name: NTF_LED_TYPES
param.documentation: Controls what types of LEDs will be enabled
param.field: 0:Built-in LED, 1:Internal ToshibaLED, 2:External ToshibaLED, 3:External PCA9685, 4:Oreo LED, 5:UAVCAN, 6:NCP5623 External, 7:NCP5623 Internal, 8:NeoPixel, 9:ProfiLED, 10:Scripting, 11:DShot

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_ON_LVL
param.documentation: Specifies pin level that indicates buzzer should play

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_VOLUME
param.documentation: Control the volume of the buzzer

param.name: NTF_LED_LEN
param.documentation: The number of Serial LED's to use for notifications (NeoPixel's and ProfiLED)

param.name: PRX_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of proximity sensor is connected

param.name: PRX_ORIENT
param.documentation: Proximity sensor orientation

param.name: PRX_YAW_CORR
param.documentation: Proximity sensor yaw correction

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG1
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 1

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID1
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 1

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG2
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 2

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID2
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 2

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG3
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 3

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID3
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 3

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG4
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 4

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID4
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 4

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG5
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 5

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID5
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 5

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG6
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 6

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID6
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 6

param.name: PRX_LOG_RAW
param.documentation: Set this parameter to one if logging unfiltered(raw) distances from sensor should be enabled

param.name: PRX_FILT
param.documentation: Cutoff frequency for low pass filter applied to each face in the proximity boundary

param.name: PSC_ACC_XY_FILT
param.documentation: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

param.name: PSC_POSZ_P
param.documentation: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

param.name: PSC_VELZ_P
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

param.name: PSC_VELZ_I
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: PSC_VELZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: PSC_VELZ_D
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: PSC_VELZ_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller Feed Forward gain. Produces an output that is proportional to the magnitude of the target

param.name: PSC_VELZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) error filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.humanName: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term
param.name: PSC_VELZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D terms

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_P
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_I
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_D
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_FF
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller feed forward

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: PSC_ACCZ_FLTT
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: PSC_ACCZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: PSC_ACCZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.name: PSC_POSXY_P
param.documentation: Position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

param.name: PSC_VELXY_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: PSC_VELXY_I
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: PSC_VELXY_D
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: PSC_VELXY_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: PSC_VELXY_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: PSC_VELXY_FLTD
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: PSC_VELXY_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: PSC_ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum lean angle autopilot can request. Set to zero to use ANGLE_MAX parameter value

param.humanName: Jerk limit for the horizontal kinematic input shaping
param.name: PSC_JERK_XY
param.documentation: Jerk limit of the horizontal kinematic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target

param.humanName: Jerk limit for the vertical kinematic input shaping
param.name: PSC_JERK_Z
param.documentation: Jerk limit of the vertical kinematic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target

param.name: RALLY_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of rally points currently loaded

param.name: RALLY_LIMIT_KM
param.documentation: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

param.name: RALLY_INCL_HOME
param.documentation: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL

param.name: RC_OVERRIDE_TIME
param.documentation: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

param.name: RC_OPTIONS
param.documentation: RC input options
param.field: 0:Ignore RC Receiver, 1:Ignore MAVLink Overrides, 2:Ignore Receiver Failsafe bit but allow other RC failsafes if setup, 3:FPort Pad, 4:Log RC input bytes, 5:Arming check throttle for 0 input, 6:Skip the arming check for neutral Roll/Pitch/Yay sticks, 7:Allow Switch reverse, 8:Use passthrough for CRSF telemetry, 9:Suppress CRSF mode/rate message for ELRS systems, 10:Enable RC Protocol re-detection

param.name: RC_PROTOCOLS
param.documentation: Bitmask of enabled RC protocols. Allows narrowing the protocol detection to only specific types of RC receivers which can avoid issues with incorrect detection. Set to 1 to enable all protocols.

param.name: RC10_REVERSED

param.name: RCMAP_ROLL
param.documentation: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_PITCH
param.documentation: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
param.documentation: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Warning APM 2.X: Changing the throttle channel could produce unexpected fail-safe results if connection between receiver and on-board PPM Encoder is lost. Disabling on-board PPM Encoder is recommended. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_FORWARD
param.documentation: Forward channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Forward is normally on channel 5, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_LATERAL
param.documentation: Lateral channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Lateral is normally on channel 6, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RELAY_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN2
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN3
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 3rd relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN4
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 4th relay control.

param.name: RELAY_DEFAULT
param.documentation: The state of the relay on boot.

param.name: RELAY_PIN5
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 5th relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN6
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 6th relay control.

param.name: RNGFND1_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

param.name: RNGFND1_PIN
param.documentation: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input

param.name: RNGFND1_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: RNGFND1_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

param.name: RNGFND1_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: RNGFND1_MIN_CM
param.documentation: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND1_MAX_CM
param.documentation: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND1_STOP_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

param.name: RNGFND1_RMETRIC
param.documentation: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

param.name: RNGFND1_PWRRNG
param.documentation: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

param.humanName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground
param.name: RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR
param.documentation: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

param.name: RNGFND1_ADDR
param.documentation: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_ORIENT
param.documentation: Orientation of rangefinder

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_MAVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_MEDF
param.documentation: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_FRQ
param.documentation: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_AVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_THR
param.documentation: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_BAUD
param.documentation: Desired baud rate

param.name: RNGFND2_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. param.documentation: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

param.name: RNGFND8_PWRRNG
param.documentation: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

param.humanName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground
param.name: RNGFND8_GNDCLEAR
param.documentation: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

param.name: RNGFND8_ADDR
param.documentation: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

param.name: RNGFND8_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND8_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND8_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND8_ORIENT
param.documentation: Orientation of rangefinder

param.name: RNGFND8_WSP_MAVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

param.name: RNGFND8_WSP_MEDF
param.documentation: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

param.name: RNGFND8_WSP_FRQ
param.documentation: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

param.name: RNGFND8_WSP_AVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

param.name: RNGFND8_WSP_THR
param.documentation: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

param.name: RNGFND8_WSP_BAUD
param.documentation: Desired baud rate

param.name: RNGFND9_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

param.name: RNGFND9_PIN
param.documentation: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input

param.name: RNGFND9_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: RNGFND9_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

param.name: RNGFND9_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: RNGFND9_MIN_CM
param.documentation: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND9_MAX_CM
param.documentation: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND9_STOP_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

param.name: RNGFND9_RMETRIC

param.name: RPM_MIN_QUAL
param.documentation: Minimum data quality to be used

param.name: RPM_PIN
param.documentation: Which pin to use

param.name: SCHED_DEBUG
param.documentation: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

param.name: SCHED_LOOP_RATE
param.documentation: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

param.name: SCHED_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This controls optional aspects of the scheduler.

param.name: SCR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls if scripting is enabled

param.name: SCR_VM_I_COUNT
param.documentation: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

param.name: SCR_HEAP_SIZE
param.documentation: Amount of memory available for scripting

param.name: SCR_DEBUG_LVL
param.documentation: The higher the number the more verbose builtin scripting debug will be.

param.name: SCR_USER1
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER2
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER3
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER4
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_DIR_DISABLE
param.documentation: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

param.name: SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL0_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the console.

param.name: SERIAL1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL1_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL2_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL3_PROTOCOL

If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL5_BAUD

param.name: SERIAL6_PROTOCOL

param.name: SERIAL6_BAUD

param.name: SERIAL1_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO

param.name: SERIAL2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO

param.name: SERIAL3_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO

param.name: SERIAL4_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO

param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO

param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from, 11: DisableFIFO

param.name: SERIAL_PASS1
param.documentation: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

param.name: SERIAL_PASS2
param.documentation: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

param.name: SERIAL_PASSTIMO
param.documentation: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

param.name: SERIAL7_PROTOCOL

param.name: SERVO_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

param.name: SERVO_DSHOT_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

param.name: SERVO_DSHOT_ESC
param.documentation: This sets the DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available. None means that no dshot commands will be executed.

param.name: SERVO10_MIN
param.documentation: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_MAX
param.documentation: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_TRIM
param.documentation: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

param.name: SERVO10_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: SERVO1_MIN
param.documentation: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO1_MAX
param.documentation: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO1_TRIM
param.documentation: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO1_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

param.name: SERVO1_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: SERVO_BLH_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

param.humanName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors
param.name: SERVO_BLH_AUTO
param.documentation: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TEST
param.documentation: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TMOUT
param.documentation: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TRATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

param.name: SERVO_BLH_DEBUG
param.documentation: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_OTYPE
param.documentation: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_PORT
param.documentation: This sets the serial port to use for blheli pass-thru

param.name: SERVO_BLH_POLES
param.documentation: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_3DMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

param.humanName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels
param.name: SERVO_BLH_BDMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_RVMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

param.name: SERVO_FTW_MASK
param.documentation: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

param.name: SERVO_FTW_RVMASK
param.documentation: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

param.name: SERVO_FTW_POLES
param.documentation: Number of motor electrical poles

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMIN
param.documentation: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMAX
param.documentation: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_SBUS_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

param.name: SERVO_VOLZ_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

param.name: TERRAIN_ENABLE
param.documentation: enable terrain data. This enables the vehicle storing a database of terrain data on the SD card. The terrain data is requested from the ground station as needed, and stored for later use on the SD card. To be useful the ground station must support TERRAIN_REQUEST messages and have access to a terrain database, such as the SRTM database.

param.name: TERRAIN_SPACING
param.documentation: Distance between terrain grid points in meters. This controls the horizontal resolution of the terrain data that is stored on te SD card and requested from the ground station. If your GCS is using the ArduPilot SRTM database like Mission Planner or MAVProxy, then a resolution of 100 meters is appropriate. Grid spacings lower than 100 meters waste SD card space if the GCS cannot provide that resolution. The grid spacing also controls how much data is kept in memory during flight. A larger grid spacing will allow for a larger amount of data in memory. A grid spacing of 100 meters results in the vehicle keeping 12 grid squares in memory with each grid square having a size of 2.7 kilometers by 3.2 kilometers. Any additional grid squares are stored on the SD once they are fetched from the GCS and will be loaded as needed.

param.name: TERRAIN_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options to change behaviour of terrain system

param.name: VISO_TYPE
param.documentation: Visual odometry camera connection type

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera X position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

param.name: VISO_ORIENT
param.documentation: Visual odometery camera orientation

param.name: VISO_SCALE
param.documentation: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

param.name: VISO_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

param.name: VISO_VEL_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

param.name: VISO_POS_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

param.name: VISO_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

param.humanName: Is the Video Transmitter enabled or not
param.name: VTX_ENABLE
param.documentation: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off

param.name: VTX_POWER
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level

param.name: VTX_CHANNEL
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Channel

param.name: VTX_BAND
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Band

param.name: VTX_FREQ
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

param.name: VTX_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels.
param.field: 0:Pitmode,1:Pitmode until armed,2:Pitmode when disarmed,3:Unlocked,4:Add leading zero byte to requests

param.name: VTX_MAX_POWER
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_UP
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_ACCEL
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.name: WPNAV_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.humanName: Waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following
param.name: WPNAV_RFND_USE
param.documentation: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

param.name: WPNAV_JERK
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal jerk in m/s/s used during missions

param.name: WPNAV_TER_MARGIN
param.documentation: Waypoint Terrain following altitude margin. Vehicle will stop if distance from target altitude is larger than this margin (in meters)
